introduction: In 1926, the coastal town of Ashbury Cove clings to survival as storms intensify and ships vanish. A sealed tradition known as the Tide Rite once calmed the seaâ€”until the names in the ledgers began to disappear.
entry_narration: The salt wind cuts cold as you arrive by the narrow causeway. The harbor is empty, the surf restless, and the old lighthouse turns without light. Somewhere in the fog, a bell tolls out of time.

key_characters.name: Eleanor Pryce
key_characters.public_info: Harbor master, sharp-eyed and exhausted, controls dock schedules and manifests.
key_characters.hidden_secrets: She has altered tide ledgers to hide the true timing of the Rite.

key_characters.name: Father Thomas O'Leary
key_characters.public_info: Priest of St. Brigid's, keeps the town calm with sermons and shelter.
key_characters.hidden_secrets: He possesses the original Rite text, which forbids human sacrifice.

key_characters.name: Clara Holt
key_characters.public_info: Widow of a missing fisherman, outspoken and relentless.
key_characters.hidden_secrets: She has a list of names removed from the town ledger.

key_characters.name: Silas Ward
key_characters.public_info: Lighthouse keeper, solitary, claims to hear voices in the surf.
key_characters.hidden_secrets: He has seen figures walk into the tide tunnel and never return.

key_characters.name: Dr. Harold Keene
key_characters.public_info: Visiting meteorologist, invited by the town council to study the storms.
key_characters.hidden_secrets: He suspects the storms are synchronized with a man-made signal.

core_secrets: The Tide Rite is a machine-like ritual that requires names, timing, and a conduit at the tide tunnel.
The Rite was altered decades ago to demand human lives, not offerings, causing the sea to take and return only echoing voices.
Ending the Rite ends the protection: the town will be struck by a catastrophic storm within hours.

possible_endings.description: The Rite continues under protest. The harbor survives, but another name is taken.
possible_endings.conditions: Players allow the Rite to proceed or fail to stop the council.

possible_endings.description: The Rite is broken. The sea crashes in and Ashbury Cove is destroyed.
possible_endings.conditions: Players disrupt the Rite and shatter the conduit.

possible_endings.description: A player takes the final place in the Rite, saving the town for a season.
possible_endings.conditions: A player willingly replaces the chosen sacrifice at the conduit.

ending_triggers: The Tide Rite completes with a sacrifice name recorded in the ledger.
The Rite is interrupted or the conduit is destroyed.
A player chooses to take the sacrifice position.

locations.name: Ashbury Harbor Office
locations.description: A cramped office of damp ledgers and tide tables, smelling of ink and salt.
secrets: a tampered ledger with ink overlays

locations.name: St. Brigid's Church
locations.description: A modest church with a cold stone cellar and a locked iron chest.
secrets: the original Rite text is hidden below

locations.name: Lighthouse Bluff
locations.description: The lighthouse stands dark, its gears still turning, overlooking a treacherous shoal.
secrets: the log mentions singing surf nights

locations.name: Tide Tunnel
locations.description: A sea-carved tunnel revealed at low tide, walls etched with old ritual marks.
secrets: the conduit is the ritual focus

locations.name: Town Hall Archives
locations.description: Shelves of municipal records and a locked drawer of council minutes.

locations.name: Old Signal Station
locations.description: A rusting hut on the cliff with a broken mast and dead telegraph wires.
secrets: the station once synchronized the Rite

scenes.title: Causeway in the Fog
scenes.summary: The investigators arrive as the tide mutters and the town watches from behind curtains.

scenes.title: Ledger of Vanished Names
scenes.summary: A tampered ledger reveals names scratched out and replaced.

scenes.title: The Original Rite
scenes.summary: In the church crypt, the true Rite text contradicts current practice.

scenes.title: The Stone Conduit
scenes.summary: The ritual focus hums as the tide begins to rise.

scenes.title: Signal of the Storm
scenes.summary: The old station reveals how the Rite was synchronized with the sea.

clues.description: A harbor ledger with dates altered and names scraped away.
clues.reveal: The Rite is tied to fixed tide windows and named sacrifices.

clues.description: A list of townsfolk missing from the census for the last decade.
clues.reveal: The council concealed the deaths to maintain the Rite.

clues.description: Original Rite pages describing offerings of oil and grain, not lives.
clues.reveal: Human sacrifice is a later corruption.

clues.description: A lighthouse log noting singing surf when the Rite is prepared.
clues.reveal: The voices grow louder just before the tide window.

clues.description: A tide table marking the exact hour the tunnel opens.
clues.reveal: The Rite must begin within a narrow low-tide window.

clues.description: A signal diagram showing synchronized lantern pulses and bell strikes.
clues.reveal: The sea responds to the signal pattern.

clues.description: A ring of stones etched with names that fade when touched.
clues.reveal: The conduit binds the next sacrifice to the Rite.

clues.description: A council letter predicting the storm if the Rite fails.
clues.reveal: The town knowingly chose sacrifice over disaster.

clues.description: Dr. Keene's notes suggesting the storms are amplified by sound pulses.
clues.reveal: Disrupting the signal may lessen the storm's force.

events.trigger: Players linger at the harbor at dusk
events.description: The fog condenses into a wall; voices whisper from the pier.
consequences: forced decision to retreat or press on

events.trigger: Players enter the church at night
events.description: The church bell rings once, then again in the wrong rhythm.
Water climbs the tunnel walls faster than expected.

events.trigger: Players tamper with the signal station
events.description: A harsh glare burns across the sea, then dies.

items.name: Rite Lantern
items.description: An oil lantern marked with worn ritual symbols.
items.effect: Required to align the signal pattern in the tunnel.

items.name: Sealed Council Minutes
items.description: A packet of council votes wrapped in wax and twine.
items.effect: Confirms the Rite was changed to include sacrifice.

items.name: Salt-Soaked Rope
items.description: A heavy rope used to secure the conduit platform.
items.effect: Prevents a fall into the brackish pool.

factions.name: Town Council
factions.goal: Keep the town alive by any means necessary.

factions.name: Harbor Families
factions.goal: Stop the disappearances and end the Rite.
factions.attitude: Angry, but willing to help outsiders.

threats.name: Tide-Echo
threats.nature: A sea-born presence that answers the Rite with voices and pull.
threats.weakness: Disrupt the signal pattern or break the conduit.

threats.name: The Stormfront
threats.nature: A supernatural squall that rises if the Rite is broken.
threats.weakness: Only the Rite can delay it.

timeline.event: The first Tide Rite is performed with offerings, not lives.
A winter storm wipes out half the fleet; the Rite is modified.
Council records begin to omit certain names.
The storms intensify; missing fishermen increase.
The latest name is chosen as the Rite begins again.
